comment_body: actually you could add "pre" and "shutdown" as 2 words instead of introducing new one and it would match attribute name "PRE_SHUTDOWN"

@VitalyVovnoboy  please review this change, since i didn't know whether we should have "tam_histogram_stat" changed to tam_microburst" (as in this change is, since stats name suggests that) or should we just change _sai_tam_microburst_stat_t to _sai_tam_histogram_stat_t
it looks like the previous name is not correct, it should be microburst stat

Yes, assuming ASIC has N internal sensors, we wanted the average of the N sensors. I can update the description. This attribute is meant to be interpreted in conjunction with the MAX_TEMP to check for deviation / discard outliers (so there are no false alarms). Alternatively, we can get the list of N values (instead of just MAX_TEMP & CURRENT_TEMP) and let the application interpret ?

How will sai_stat_id_t look ?
Will it be a big enum containing all the list of every counter for every functionality ?
Where will the definition sit ?
Or did you mean to cast the specific functionality counter to uint ?

@itaibaz Yes, sai_stat_id_t is the data-type defined to uint32_t similar to the the sai_attr_id_t type used for attribute id. API implementation is just made uniform with a single data-type for all objects.

i missed this commit, i i would have some objectsions, to this change, since having each separate enum would enforce user on compile time if he passed wrong stats id in the enum, and if we have unified this to stat id, we need to cast each enum to that tape

@kcudnik stat id was unified to a common type in the Stats API signature just like the attribute id type in the set API. It is to help generate any meta data and/or common code for handling all stats get APIs.

Yes, i get that part, but we sacrifice compile time checks, and it's still easy to generate common code for even if we have each stat api with different enum, we already did that in sairedis and vslib https://github.com/Azure/sonic-sairedis/tree/master/syncd

As I briefly explained in today's meeting
Currently there is existing attribute SAI_SWITCH_ATTR_RESTART_WARM, which serves as a hint a warm restart procedure is restarting
After such boot, on some ASICs, SAI is reinitialized from scratch, and SAI_KEY_BOOT_TYPE has the value of the boot type done
On other ASIC, SAI is not reinitialized from scratch, rather the process is resumed. A hint that the process is resumed is needed, and that's where the new attribute comes into play

I agree, the referred document pipeline_v6.pdf<https://github.com/opencomputeproject/SAI/blob/master/doc/behavioral%20model/pipeline_v6.pdf> doesn’t seem to provide the resolution logic if both, route and neighbor, tables are hit. I am also trying to find a scenario when this can happen (from application’s perspective).

Regards,
Atit

From: Sathish Kumar [mailto:notifications@github.com]
Sent: Wednesday, June 20, 2018 5:59 PM
To: opencomputeproject/SAI
Cc: Jain, Atit; Mention
Subject: Re: [opencomputeproject/SAI] SAI Test cases (#827)


External Email

@SathishKumarTR-Dell commented on this pull request.

________________________________

In test/saithrift/tests/SAITest.md<https://github.com/opencomputeproject/SAI/pull/827#discussion_r196756078>:

> +

+2.     L3DirectedBroadcast – II (VLAN checks)

+After executing “L3DirectedBroadcast – I”, add and remove ports to the VLAN.  When a port is added, the L3 broadcast traffic must also be forwarded on the newly added member port and similar test to be executed by removing existing member port from VLAN.

+

+3.     L3LpbkSubnetTest

+Send traffic on a layer 3 router interface destined to an IPv4 address within the same subnet. Have the nhop entry learnt on the same interface as incoming interface. Verify that packet is send out on the same outgoing interface as the incoming interface. Set the SAI_ROUTER_INTERFACE_ATTR_LOOPBACK_PACKET_ACTION attribute to _drop_ and verify that packet is _not_ send out on the same outgoing RIF as incoming RIF.

+

+4.     L3MtuTest

+Send L3 destined packet with max interface MTU and verify forwarding. With L3 destined packet, verifying the forwarding behavior also ensures IP MTU value configured for the router interface. Increase the packet size beyond the configured MTU value and verify the behavior. Default action is to drop packets exceeding configured MTU

+

+5.     L2MtuTest

+Send untagged packet with max MTU size and verify forwarding.  Add VLAN tag so that the total packet size exceeds the MTU value and verify behavior. Default action is to drop packets exceeding configured MTU value.

+

+6.     L3IPv4/32Test - I

+(Ref: https://github.com/opencomputeproject/SAI/blob/master/doc/behavioral%20model/pipeline_v6.pdf, router flow)

+Add a route entry with /32 prefix (e.g. 10.1.1.1/32 via NH1) and a neighbor entry for the same IP address (e.g. 10.1.1.1 MAC1 Port1). Send traffic and verify that the packet takes the path specified by the /32 route entry and _not_ the neighbor path.

For the directly reachable routes, egress_rif will be filled in the SAI_ROUTE_ENTRY_ATTR_NEXT_HOP_ID attribute.
And, the "egress_rif, pkt_dst_ip" would be matched in the "Neigh table" instead of the "egress_rif,NH_DstIP" as captured in the "Ingress router flow" diagram.
In that case, there will be two matches for the packet in this scenario (/32 route && neighbor entry coexist) - both in the Router table and in the Neigh table. Then, there should be a stage that determines which one of the matches will take precedence. It looks like that is not defined explicitly in the pipeline model currently.

in case of switchobject id we could assume that we use switch_id on which we perform operation, but still challenging logic problem would stand

build failure?
The attribute cannot end with "START". Rename the attribute and build passes.
shall we change the attribute name to INIT or is it better to keep the _START suffix but fix the meta check?

My understanding is that _START and _End are reserved to indicate the start and end of attr enum type. I don't think it worth to break this standard and change the meta check. @kcudnik might be more authorized for this question.

yea, start and end are reserved for beggining and ending attributes list, actual regex is looking for _END and _START thats why all attributes with those suffixes will match, it can be restrected more to only match foo_ATTR_(END|START)

Almost 600 files in one commit ? can you split that into couple PR ? Are all files go to BM directory ?

1) All files are in the BM directory.
2) this PR  needs the P4 environment (~60% of the files), found under BM/p4-softswtich/. it is required to compile the BM.
3) this pull request can be splitted: the PTF, unittest, and sai_thrift_server (BM/sai_adapter/tests/ ~100 files)  are done in another PR, but I think that the tests show usage examples and simplify the model understanding.

yes, this provides the official SAI compliant software switch.
@snifbh, can you rename the root directory to bm? we are using non capital letters.
@lguohan  done.

did we modify any p4 switch behavior model? Is it possible to use submodule to link to a p4 switch behavior model here? The concern is that from time to time we probably want to upgrade to a new p4 switch behavior model. 

I prefer to only have following in the SAI repo.

- our p4 program, P4-SAI.
- Implementation of the SAI API over the P4 BM.
- unit test example for the sai api usage.
- Thirft sai server implementation and ptf tests.

Then, we can have a submodule link to bmv2 software, so that we can compile our P4-SAI model. 

This may be cleaner and more easy to understand our own contribution.

@lguohan
I agree that using the behavioral model as submodule here is much cleaner.
But we have implementation issue: 
Currently the behavioral model doesn't support external target (our P4-SAI MUST be in the behavioral-model/targets/ folder)
We might be able work around this, but it will be much less clean.
I'll try to open the external target feature with the P4 community, but for now, I suggest we keep it like this.
we can do this using our own build script, for example, first copy our target to the behaviroal-model/targets/folder and then compile.
@lguohan done.
